body_html:
While I understand this viewpoint, I actually think your suggestions will make the documentation less informative and bloated to those with a basic understanding of neural networks. The notation of W, b and y are common to the ML/NN literature, as is the dot operation.

It really depends on who tensor flow is aimed at. If it geared as an intro to neural networks/ML, then I think your suggestions make sense but I think they are targeting a different audience.
body_text:
While I understand this viewpoint, I actually think your suggestions will make the documentation less informative and bloated to those with a basic understanding of neural networks.  The notation of W, b and y are common to the ML/NN literature, as is the dot operation.
It really depends on who tensor flow is aimed at.  If it geared as an intro to neural networks/ML, then I think your suggestions make sense but I think they are targeting a different audience.
body:
While I understand this viewpoint, I actually think your suggestions will make the documentation less informative and bloated to those with a basic understanding of neural networks.  The notation of `W`, `b` and `y` are common to the ML/NN literature, as is the dot operation.  

It really depends on who tensor flow is aimed at.  If it geared as an intro to neural networks/ML, then I think your suggestions make sense but I think they are targeting a different audience.
